definition: home-loving/to feel a strong attachment to home life/to begrudge being away from home
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I long for family, because family is the best haven.
sentences.chinese: 我戀家，因爲家是最好的避風港。

sentences.english: Who would have thought that my honeysuckle , and she did love home.
sentences.chinese: 有誰會想到，我的金銀花，她那樣戀家。

sentences.english: Cancerians have a deep love for home, and they truly treasure their friends and family.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座的人是個戀家控，他們視朋友家人爲珍寶。

sentences.english: I was a family man, love does not need the reason.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個戀家的男人，戀家不需要理由。

sentences.english: I was a family man, love does not need the reason.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個戀家的男人，戀家不需要理由。

sentences.english: She's a family person, so am I.
sentences.chinese: 她是個戀家的人，我也是。

sentences.english: I will think naught of my family when I am in the market place for this will cloud my thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 身在職場，不可戀家，否則那會使我思想混飩。

sentences.english: I was quite a proverb for it at Maple Grove.
sentences.chinese: 在楓園，我的戀家是盡人皆知的。

sentences.english: In the summer, the wolves are homebodies, taking care of new pups.
sentences.chinese: 通常而言，夏天的狼羣是“戀家”的，同時照顧小狼。

sentences.english: "Love" is a good lead from Ruili to the excellent source of strength.
sentences.chinese: “戀家”是帶領瑞麗從優秀到卓越的力量源泉。

sentences.english: He really loves his family, and returns home once a week.
sentences.chinese: 他真是戀家，一週總要回去一趟。

definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to take care of one's family
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
